statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} -7 \\ -9 \\ 13 \\ -9 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ -2 \\ 0 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -3 \\ 0 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -1 \\ 4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} -7 \\ -9 \\ 13 \\ -9 \end{array}\right] is a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 3 \\ -2 \\ 0 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 2 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ -3 \\ 0 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ -1 \\ 4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right].
